ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò la gwɔ́ tà ńtɔ́g, agyáŋalóŋ fùɔ Zɛɛzɛ́sè sẅéte. Á gíŋe ńkwaŋte mmó gie Vashÿeti ka gÿo, mbɔɔ lepʉ̌ sie mé la záb ńtí yé.
en: Some time later,   when King Ahasuerus’s rage  # 2:1 Est 1:12; 7:10 had cooled down, he remembered Vashti, what she had done, and what was decided against her.  # 2:1 Est 1:10–12,16–21

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie é lɔ́ɔn faʼa mbwó fùɔ gɔɔn ngie me gʉa faʼ púɔngùɔ pie é tẅɛ tɛʼ, mbà pɔ́ kaa mámbàŋa zsé, ńdɔg ńtó ńnáa mbwó gù fùɔ.
en: The king’s personal attendants suggested, “Let a search be made for beautiful young virgins for the king.

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, gʉa tsɛ̀ɛ mepàg láʼ mú ntsèm, ńtsɔ́ʼ pʉ̀a, pɔ́ líe púɔngùɔ pie é sí tɛʼ, mbà pɔ́ kaa mámbàŋa zsé, ńcúʼte wɔ́b néŋe tsɛ̀ɛ ndá panzwě gie ee Sẅísè gẅie aa sẅɛ̂láʼ. Nyìŋ gẅie à ge ne líe wɔ́b gwɔ́ Heguwe gẅie mé la shʉ́ʉ yé, á pyɛ́be mezwě fùɔ, mé piŋ ńná mevɛ́ lɔg ńzɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ ntí ntí né pɔ́b.
en: Let the king appoint commissioners   in each province of his kingdom, so that they may gather all the beautiful young virgins to the harem at the fortress of Susa.  # 2:3 Neh 1:1; Est 1:1; Dn 8:2 Put them under the supervision of Hegai, the king’s eunuch,  # 2:3 Est 1:10 keeper of the women,  # 2:3 Est 2:8–9,12–13 and give them the required beauty treatments.

ngiemboon: Múɔ manzwě gẅie anò yé ge gÿo kúu twó fùɔ, à ge gwɔ́ gẅie mé ge lɔgɔ yé kúbe twó Vashÿeti, à cʉ́ʼʉ mɔ̌ɔn nɔʼ. Yɔ̀ɔn nò gie mé la kaʼ pú ḿboŋo fùɔ, tà mé ké ńgÿo pɔ́ púʼu.
en: Then the young woman who pleases the king   will become queen instead of Vashti.”  # 2:4 Est 1:19 This suggestion pleased the king, and he did accordingly.

ngiemboon: Á laa Sẅísè gẅie aa sẅɛ̂láʼ, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ Yúndà gwɔ́ wó, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ lê Mandoshÿe, á gwɔ́ míŋ Yayî, éfóo na ngẅɛ̀ Shÿimeyi, pɔ́ Kíshÿè na pʉ̀a ngẅɛ̀te Mbɛŋjÿamɛŋ.
en: In the fortress of Susa, there was a Jewish man named Mordecai   son of Jair, son of Shimei,  # 2:5 2Sm 6:5–13 son of Kish,  # 2:5 1Sm 9:1 a Benjaminite.

ngiemboon: Mandoshÿe ŋwɛ́ laa nùɔ pʉ̀a pie Nambukondonozɔɔ fùɔ Mbambilonia la gwoon wɔ́b lâ Yekonia fùɔ pʉ̀a Yúndà ńdɔg fóo Yelúzálèm ńgʉa, pɔ́ cʉ́ʼ menkwɔɔn.
en: Kish   had been taken into exile from Jerusalem with the other captives when King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon took King Jeconiah of Judah into exile.  # 2:6 2Kg 24:10–15; 2Ch 36:10; Jr 24:1; 29:1–2

ngiemboon: Mandoshÿe laa tátsáb Andásà gẅie á gíŋe ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie Ésétà, á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ɔ míŋ ndyè we wemanzwě. Tá we la te nyé wó wɔ́, má we te nyé wó wɔ́, á piŋ ńgwɔ́ múɔ manzwě ńtẅɛ tɛʼ. Tá we pɔ́ má we la gwɔ́ tà ńkwé, Mandoshÿe zɔ̌ cʉ́ʼ ńkwéʼte yé.
en: Mordecai was the legal guardian of his cousin   Hadassah (that is, Esther), because she had no father or mother. The young woman had a beautiful figure and was extremely good-looking. When her father and mother died, Mordecai had adopted her as his own daughter.  # 2:7 Est 9:29

ngiemboon: Mé la gwɔ́ tà ńtóŋ lepʉ̌ sie fùɔ la ŋweʼe é shwóŋo láʼ, mé cúʼte púɔ panzwě tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn á Sẅísè gẅie à laa sẅɛ̂láʼ, nyìŋ gẅie à la ne ńdíe wɔ́b gwɔ́ Heguwe. Heguwe gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn ḿbyɛ́bɛ panzwě nɔʼ tsẅi mé lɔgɔ Ésétà ńgʉa né ndá fùɔ.
en: When the king’s command and edict became public knowledge and when many young women were gathered at the fortress of Susa under Hegai’s supervision, Esther was taken to the palace, into the supervision of Hegai, keeper of the women.

ngiemboon: Múɔ manzwě ŋwɛ́ la pú ḿboŋo Heguwe, á lɔgɔ sẅɛte ńdeen ńcʉ́ʼ ńná pɔ́ shúm sie à ge lɔg kẅiŋ mbùm ye, mbɔɔ sie à ge ne pfɛ́ɛ, ńgʉa ndá fùɔ ńtsɔ́ʼ púɔ panzwě sɔɔnmbʉ́a pie é ge ne faʼa mbwó yé, ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgʉa ndá mezwě fùɔ ńnéŋe wɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ lûmndá gẅie à pǔ ḿboŋ.
en: The young woman pleased him and gained his favor so that he accelerated the process of the beauty treatments and the special diet that she received. He assigned seven hand-picked female servants to her from the palace and transferred her and her servants to the harem’s best quarters.

ngiemboon: Ésétà la te gÿo mé zsé tsìŋendá yɔ́b mbɔɔ lefǒ sé wɔ́, á nue Mandoshÿe la tɔʼɔ yé ngie tà á gÿo tà mé zsé lefǒ sé.
en: Esther did not reveal her ethnicity or her family background, because Mordecai had ordered her not to make them known.

ngiemboon: Mandoshÿe lɔ̌ɔn ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ ntsèm, ńgwá ńjʉŋte metsẅé ndá á jʉʼ gie mé leʼe panzwě wó, lélíe kà Ésétà aa ntentʉ́ wɔ́ɔ, é piŋ gyá ntí gie mé ne ńdɔgɔ ńgẅiin yé.
en: Every day Mordecai took a walk in front of the harem’s courtyard to learn how Esther was doing and to see what was happening to her.

ngiemboon: Epúɔ panzwě pie é laa tsɛ̀ɛ ndá panzwě ŋwɛ́ la gẅiin tàʼ ngùʼ lélɔg ńnéŋe tẅɛ̀ mbùm pɔ́b páʼ á la ne ńzɛ́te. Á gwɔ́ ngie melùŋmvfò saŋ ntɔgɔ́, mé lɔg mevɛ́ mîi, ńzɔ́ʼɔ wɔ́b, metsɔ́ mesaŋ ntɔgɔ́ mé lɔg mevɛ́ gyě, mbɔɔ tsɔ́ shúm sie panzwě lɔgɔ ńnéŋe tẅɛ̀ na pɔ́b. Wɛ̌ múɔ manzwě wɔ́ɔ gẅiin yé lyɛ̌ʼ gie à ge gʉa gyá fùɔ Zɛɛzɛ́sè.
en: During the year before each young woman’s turn to go to King Ahasuerus, the harem regulation required her to receive beauty treatments with oil of myrrh for six months and then with perfumes and cosmetics for another six months.

ngiemboon: Alyɛ̌ʼ gie múɔ manzwě ge gyá fùɔ lɔ́ɔn ńgwɔ́ tà ńkuʼu, mé náa kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á zɛ́te légwɔ́ gie à lɔg fó ndá panzwě ńgʉa né tsɛ̀ɛ nɔʼ.
en: When the young woman would go to the king, she was given whatever she requested to take with her from the harem to the palace.

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌ múɔ manzwě wɔ́ɔ lɔ̌ɔn ńgee ncwònzém légyá fùɔ, ńtóo ḿbiŋe pɔ́ mbaʼámbaʼ, ńcʉ́ʼ ńgʉa pɔ́ ne yetsɔ̌ ndá mezwě fùɔ gie Shÿashÿagaa gẅie mé la shʉ́ʉ yé á piŋe ḿbyɛ́bɛ memágàb fùɔ zɔ̌ cʉ́ʼ ńdíe yé. Tà tsɔ̌ gwaa gíŋe piŋ nzèm gyá fùɔ á gwɔ́ páʼ fùɔ tsɔ̌ɔn nò yé, ńcʉ́ʼ ńtúm mé toŋo yé pɔ́ ne lezíŋ sé.
en: She would go in the evening, and in the morning she would return to a second harem under the supervision of the king’s eunuch Shaashgaz, keeper of the concubines.   She never went to the king again, unless he desired her and summoned her by name.  # 2:14 Est 4:11

ngiemboon: Alyɛ̌ʼ ye Ésétà míŋ Hambihayi ndyè Mandoshÿe gẅie à la kwéʼte yé páʼ à lɔ̌ɔn ńge gʉa gyá fùɔ la gwɔ́ tà ńkuʼ, à te zɛ́te tsɔ́ mmó ndyɛ̀ʼɛ tà ńtɔ́gɔ gie Heguwe gẅie mé la shʉ́ʉ yé á pyɛ́bɛ mezwě fùɔ la shwóŋo yé wɔ́. Wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn ńgyá Ésétà lɔ̌ɔn ńkwoŋo nò yé.
en: Esther was the daughter of Abihail,   the uncle of Mordecai who had adopted her as his own daughter. When her turn came to go to the king, she did not ask for anything except what Hegai, the king’s eunuch, keeper of the women, suggested. Esther gained favor in the eyes of everyone who saw her.  # 2:15 Est 5:2,8

ngiemboon: Mé la tó faʼa Ésétà lé gʉa ńnáa mbwó fùɔ Zɛɛzɛ́sè á tsɛ̀ɛ ndá yé, á laa mbɔ́ɔntè saŋ legém, mé gɔɔn saŋ gẅie pʉ̀a Yúndà tóŋo lê tebɛd, é lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ mbɔ́ɔntè ngùʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a páʼ fùɔ Zɛɛzɛ́sè la ne sáʼa láʼ.
en: She was taken to King Ahasuerus in the palace in the tenth month, the month Tebeth, in the seventh year of his reign.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ la pú ńkwoŋo Ésétà ńcʉa petsɔ́ panzwě, afùɔ la pú ńzáb ntʉ́m wé na yé, ńgiŋe ńdíe yé ńcʉa petsɔ́ púɔngùɔ. Á leen ńké ńtɔʼ yɔb ntí nkàŋmbúm twó yé, ńtÿɔ́gɔ yé na jʉʼʉ Vashÿeti, á cʉʼʉ mɔ̌ɔn nɔʼ.
en: The king loved Esther more than all the other women. She won more favor and approval from him than did any of the other virgins. He placed the royal crown on her head and made her queen in place of Vashti.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ leen ńké ńgÿo máa línɔ̀ɔn ńtóŋ lé línɔ̀ɔn Ésétà, ńtóŋ memǎa mengúmnɔ̀ɔn pâ meŋwǎláʼ pé. À la gɔɔn ngie tà mé péen tágsè tsɛ̀ɛ meláʼ, ḿbiŋ ńdɔgɔ pòŋontʉ́m ńgabte shúm páʼ ńgwɔ́ fùɔ gabte púʼu mbwó láʼ yé.
en: The king held a great banquet for all his officials and staff.   It was Esther’s banquet. He freed his provinces from tax payments and gave gifts worthy of the king’s bounty.  # 2:18 Est 1:7

ngiemboon: Mé la gíŋe ńgwɔ́ cúʼtè púɔngùɔ na lekwò mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a, Mandoshÿe cʉ́ʼ ńnéŋe pɔ́ ncwò ndá gẅie mé tóŋo lê ncwò ndá fùɔ.
en: When the virgins   were gathered a second time, Mordecai was sitting at the King’s Gate.  # 2:19 Est 5:13

ngiemboon: Á la ké ńgwaa gwɔ́ púʼu mbà Ésétà kaa kem lefǒo sé mbɔɔ tsìŋendá yɔ́b wɔ́, á gwɔ́ páʼ Mandoshÿe la shwóŋo yé púʼu. Ésétà laa púʼu ńké nyé ńjúʼu pɔ́ ncwò Mandoshÿe páʼ fʉ̀ʼ gie à la nyé ńgwɔ́ mbʉ̀a yé lá.
en: Esther still did not reveal her family background or her ethnicity, as Mordecai had directed. She obeyed Mordecai’s orders, as she always had while he raised her.

ngiemboon: Á laa tsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, Mandoshÿe ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ncwò fàʼ yé tsɛ̀ɛ nɔʼ, Mbigetaŋ pɔ́ Telɛ́shÿè pie mé la shʉ́ʉ wɔ́b pɔ́ piŋe ḿbyɛ́bɛ ncwò nkáʼ lékúu ndá fùɔ Zɛɛzɛ́sè ne ńjÿó menáŋ lezẅé fùɔ ńtí páʼ pɔ́ la ne ńgyáŋa lóŋ ńtíi fùɔ.
en: During those days while Mordecai was sitting at the King’s Gate, Bigthan and Teresh, two of the king’s eunuchs   who guarded the entrance, became infuriated and planned to assassinate  # 2:21 Lit and they sought to stretch out a hand against King Ahasuerus.

ngiemboon: Anò ayɛ̌ gwe metuŋó Mandoshÿe, á leen ńké shwóŋo Ésétà. Ésétà cʉ́ʼʉ léshwóŋo fùɔ, éshwóŋo yé ngie Mandoshÿe kěm menáŋ mie mé ne ńjÿó ńtíi yé fùɔ.
en: When Mordecai learned of the plot, he reported it to Queen Esther, and she told the king on Mordecai’s behalf.

ngiemboon: Mé leen ńké ńtúŋte nò ayɛ̌ ńjúʼ á gwɔ́ nò nénʉ́. Mé leen ńkwéʼe pʉ̀a pá mépʉ́a ńcʉŋe tÿǒ. Mé la tyé pɔ́ mvfò fùɔ ńŋweʼe nò ayɛ̌ tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne gie mé lɔ́ɔn ŋweʼe menò ntʉ tʉ mie é cʉaté nɔʼ tsoló.
en: When the report was investigated and verified, both men were hanged on the gallows.   This event was recorded in the Historical Record in the king’s presence.
